citations.narrative:
The drain in the North American river otter indoor holding is not constructed in a manner to prevent back-up of sewage. In
October 2023, during construction on the main building adjacent to the otter enclosure and indoor housing, sewage from
the main sewage line backed up out of the floor drain in indoor river otter housing. The facility identified a problem with the
city's sewage lift system which was corrected. The otter was in temporary housing at the time of this backup. On August
2, 2025, sewage once again backed up out of the drain in indoor otter holding but was remedied within several hours. The
otter was not inside at the time and was kept outside until the situation was corrected. Sewage that backs-up out of a
drain into an indoor holding facility for animals can expose animals to increased disease risks and increased ammonia
levels in the air. Correct by 28 August 2025 by ensuring that all indoor housing facilities are constructed in a manner to
avoid foul odors and installed so as to prevent any backup of sewage.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the attending veterinarian and facilities manager.
